items.title: AI copyright expert drops Meta as client over policy shifts
items.author: Mark Lemley
items.summary:
- Mark Lemley, Stanford Law professor, ends representation of Meta.
- Cited Meta's policy shifts and changes in the tech industry as reasons.
- Concern over alignment with political figures and reduced support for DEI initiatives.
- Lemley maintains support for Meta in current AI copyright disputes.

items.title: Unpacking Maka Motors’ long-awaited EV debut
items.author: Raditya Wibowo
items.summary:
- Maka Motors unveils its electric motorcycle in Jakarta after three years and nearly US$38 million in funding.
- CEO Raditya Wibowo emphasizes readiness for market, stating no buzz was created until the product was ready.
- The electric motorcycle, Maka Cavalry, priced at 35.9 million rupiah (US$2,194), has already received orders and promises delivery in February.
- The company aims to sell 15,000 units in 2025 and plans to expand with 14 new showrooms this year.

items.title: The 50 top-funded greentech companies in Asia
items.summary:
- The list identifies the top 50 cleantech companies in Asia based on funding raised over the past two years.
- Data sourced from Tech in Asia, which is regularly updated.
- Focus on companies likely to lead the green revolution based on financial support received.

items.title: AI-enabled smartphone shipments to surge 73%: report
items.summary:
- Global shipments of AI-enabled smartphones projected to increase by 73.1% year-on-year in 2025 according to IDC report.
- Significant adoption of generative AI features driving sector growth.
- Growth expected to reach 912 million units by 2028 with a compound annual growth rate of 78.4% from 2024 to 2028.
- Advancements in AI to drive upgrades, creating opportunities for vendors and app developers.
- Samsung launched Galaxy S25 series on Jan. 23 featuring multimodal AI capabilities.

items.title: Great entrepreneurs aren’t born. They are made
items.author: Willson Cuaca
items.summary:
- The article explores whether great entrepreneurs are born or made, concluding that they are made through three key elements: capacity, character, and capability.
- Capacity is innate; character is shaped over time by various factors; and capability is acquired through education and experience.
- Privileged individuals may have advantages but character is seen as the most crucial trait for entrepreneurial success, with real character revealing itself during challenging times.

items.title: Trump signs executive order to boost crypto economy
items.summary:
- Trump has signed an executive order aimed at boosting the cryptocurrency economy in the United States.
- The order outlines a comprehensive framework for digital asset regulation and establishes the importance of crypto technologies.
- The move is expected to foster innovation while addressing risks associated with cryptocurrencies, including financial stability and consumer protection.

items.title: Substack launches $20m fund to attract video creators
items.summary:
- Substack has launched a US$20 million creator accelerator fund aimed at attracting video creators, notably those impacted by TikTok uncertainties.
- The fund provides financial guarantees to alleviate potential revenue loss during the transition and offers early access to new features and business support.
- This initiative is a part of Substack's transition from a newsletter platform to a broader creator platform, addressing challenges in ownership and audience retention due to changing policies on other platforms.

items.title: Trump’s AI project Stargate set to support OpenAI
items.summary:
- Stargate is a new AI infrastructure initiative by President Donald Trump to support OpenAI.
- The project aims to invest US$100 billion initially, potentially scaling up to US$500 billion over the next four years.
- OpenAI and SoftBank are the primary backers, with Oracle and Abu Dhabi’s MGX AI fund as founding partners.
- SoftBank and OpenAI plan to contribute over US$15 billion each to the initiative.

items.title: The biggest investment considerations for ESG and healthcare
items.summary:
- The article discusses key investment factors to consider in ESG and healthcare sectors.
- Highlights the growing importance of sustainability and ethical investing.
- Analyzes market trends and potential impacts on capital allocation in healthcare.

items.title: Ex-Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger invests in AI startup
items.summary:
- Ex-Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger has made an investment in an AI startup.
- The investment is part of a broader trend of tech leaders backing AI-driven companies.
- This move highlights the increasing significance of AI in the tech industry.

items.title: Spotify CEO’s healthtech startup raises $260m in funding
items.summary:
- Spotify CEO Daniel Ek's healthtech startup has successfully raised $260 million in funding.
- The funding round was led by various prominent investors.
- This move marks a significant step towards advancing health technology services offered by the startup.

items.title: India urges Apple, Google to pre-install gov’t app suite
items.summary:
- India’s technology ministry requests Apple and Google to include the Gov.in app suite in their marketplaces.
- The government wants these apps pre-installed on smartphones sold in India to increase accessibility.
- Google is hesitant about the request, while Apple may not comply without legal changes.
- This initiative is similar to Apple’s prior action in Russia regarding government-recommended apps.

items.title: Open-source AI software startup Pipeshift raises $2.5m
items.author: Arko Chattopadhyay
items.summary:
- Pipeshift has raised US$2.5 million in a seed funding round led by Y Combinator and SenseAI Ventures.
- Other investors include Arka Venture Labs, Good News Ventures, and several angel investors from Silicon Valley.
- The funding will enhance the platform and expand its adoption across various industries.
- Pipeshift provides a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) for deploying open-source AI models in cloud and on-premises settings.
- CEO Arko Chattopadhyay stated the goal is to help enterprises deploy and scale generative AI models more efficiently.

items.title: India watchdog orders new probe into Foxconn’s hiring
items.summary:
- India’s National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has ordered a new investigation into Foxconn’s hiring practices related to alleged employment discrimination.
- Foxconn is accused of excluding married women from assembly line jobs, with the policy only relaxed during high-production periods.
- Documents showed only 6.7% of the 33,360 women employed at the factory were married, but it was unclear if they worked on the assembly line.
- The NHRC criticized Tamil Nadu labor officials for insufficient investigations, as they failed to review hiring records.
- Foxconn's job advertisements reportedly included discriminatory criteria that have since been removed.

items.title: Israel’s AI logistic firm raises $14m for delivery tech
items.summary:
- Package.ai, an AI-driven logistics firm, raised US$14 million in Series A funding led by Susquehanna Growth Equity.
- This is the company's first institutional investment since its founding in 2017.
- Package.ai, located in Tel Aviv and New York, has about 20 employees and serves clients like Ashley DSG, Big Sandy Home Furnishings, and Yale Appliance.
- The funding aims to help the company approach profitability and enhance its customer base.

items.title: Weekly funding: Chinese chipmaker InventChip raises $138m
Abu Dhabi investment firm MGX backs Trump’s $100b AI plan
items.summary:
- Abu Dhabi-based investment firm MGX has committed US$7 billion to a US$100 billion AI infrastructure initiative named Stargate.
- The venture, launched by President Donald Trump, includes tech companies OpenAI, SoftBank Group Corp., and Oracle Corp.
- MGX was established in March 2024, with founding partners Mubadala Investment Co. and AI firm G42.
- The fund aims to become a significant player in the global AI sector.
- It is targeting US$100 billion in assets by combining Mubadala’s financial strength with G42’s technological expertise.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Glasswall is a new initiative by Tech in Asia aimed at helping founders choose the right investors by sharing anonymous reviews.
- It allows founders to provide feedback on venture capitalists (VCs) without disclosing their identities.
- The initiative seeks to encourage more open discussions about investor experiences in the startup community.

items.title: SK hynix hits $46b revenue on AI-driven chip demand
items.summary:
- SK hynix achieved a revenue of $46 billion, driven by increased demand for AI-related chips.
- The surge in revenue reflects the growing importance of AI technology in various industries.
- The company continues to invest in expanding its chip production capabilities to meet future demand.

items.title: HTC to sell part of XR unit to Google for $250m
items.summary:
- HTC announced on Jan. 23, 2025, plans to sell part of its XR division to Google for $250 million.
- HTC employees focused on XR R&D will transfer to Google as part of the deal.
- Google will receive a nonexclusive license to HTC’s XR intellectual property rights.
- The transaction is expected to close by the end of Q1 2025.

items.title: Saudi digital bank Derayah plans IPO, offering 20% stake
items.summary:
- Derayah Financial Co. plans to offer 20% of its share capital in an IPO on Tadawul.
- The Capital Market Authority approved the listing on Dec. 25, allowing for 49.95 million shares.
- The IPO will feature a partial sale by existing shareholders, with no proceeds for the company.
- Shares will begin trading after completing formalities with the CMA and Tadawul.
- HSBC Saudi Arabia serves as the financial adviser and underwriter for the offering.

items.title: HSBC shuts down payments app Zing
items.summary:
- HSBC is closing its global payments app Zing, just one year after its launch.
- This decision is part of the bank's restructuring and could impact up to 400 jobs, including customer service roles.
- Zing was launched in the UK in January 2024 and allowed users to manage multiple currencies with a multi-currency debit card.

items.title: Competition, boycotts threaten to sink Unilever Indonesia’s reign
items.summary:
- Unilever Indonesia is facing increased competition and boycotts that threaten its market position.
- Consumers are shifting towards local brands amid growing awareness and nationalism.
- The company needs to innovate and adapt to new consumer preferences to maintain its market dominance.

items.title: VC firm 500 Global launches Saudi-based fund
items.summary:
- 500 Global launches 500 MENA, a fund for tech startups in the Middle East and North Africa.
- Fund is based in Riyadh and backed by Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund and Saudi Venture Capital.
- Plans to invest up to US$10 million per deal in sectors like software-as-a-service, fintech, and AI in Saudi Arabia and the UAE.
- 500 Global manages US$2.3 billion in assets and has been operational in the region since 2012.

items.title: ByteDance said to invest $20b in AI infrastructure globally
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- ByteDance plans to invest $20 billion in global AI infrastructure.
- This investment highlights ByteDance's commitment to AI development.
- The move is positioned to enhance technologies across its platforms.

items.title: Eximius Ventures launches $30m Fund II
items.summary:
- Eximius Ventures launched its second fund with a target of US$30 million.
- The fund will invest in 25 to 30 companies in sectors like fintech, AI, frontier technology, and consumer technology.
- Each company will receive an initial investment of US$500,000, with half of the fund reserved for follow-on investments.
- The firm has already invested in four companies in the consumer tech and AI sectors.
- The fund is backed by diverse limited partners, including high-net-worth individuals and corporate venture firms.

items.title: India’s Ati Motors raises $20m series B
items.summary:
- Ati Motors raised US$20 million in series B funding.
- Investment round co-led by Walden Catalyst Ventures and NGP Capital.
- Participation from existing investors including True Ventures, Exfinity Venture Partners, Athera Venture Partners, and Blume Ventures.
- Sherpa robots deployed in 40 manufacturing facilities worldwide, serving clients like Forvia and Hyundai.
- New capital will enhance AI models and industrial automation technologies.

items.title: Xanh SM, Indosat partner for EV growth in Indonesia
items.summary:
- Xanh SM and Indosat announce partnership to promote electric vehicle (EV) adoption in Indonesia.
- The collaboration aims to increase EV infrastructure and services across the country.
- Key focus on enhancing charging networks and sustainable transportation solutions.

items.title: Indian skincare firm raises $7.5m to develop new products
items.summary:
- An Indian skincare company has successfully raised $7.5 million in funding.
- The new funds will be used to develop new products, enhancing their product line.
- This investment demonstrates investor confidence in the skincare sector in India.

items.title: SG digibanks brace for what’s next
items.summary:
- Digital banks in Singapore, including GXS, MariBank, and Trust, are experiencing growth by offering attractive interest rates on savings accounts.
- Their main challenge now is incentivizing customers to use these accounts for daily transactions through cashback and loyalty programs.
- Digital banks leverage data and AI to provide personalized financial solutions, targeting underserved market segments.
- Future growth for these banks will include expanding beyond basic banking services to offer investment products and solutions for SMEs.

items.title: Meta links WhatsApp to Instagram, Facebook
items.summary:
[Meta integrates WhatsApp with Instagram and Facebook for improved connectivity.]
[This allows users to interact across platforms seamlessly.]
[The update enhances user experience and expands cross-platform functionalities.]

items.title: Indonesian tech startups funding drops 75% in 2024: report
items.summary:
- In 2024, Indonesian tech startups secured **US$323 million** in funding, a 75% decline from **US$1.3 billion** in 2023.
- Compared to **US$3.24 billion** in 2022, this represents a **90.05%** drop.
- Late-stage funding decreased by **91.95%** to **US$71.2 million** in 2024, down from **US$884 million** in 2023.
- Seed-stage funding fell **61.54%** to **US$30.3 million**, while early-stage investments dropped **32.18%** to **US$221 million**.
- Top-performing sectors included **FinTech**, **Enterprise Applications**, and **InsurTech**.
- **Jakarta** accounted for **85.36%** of total funds raised, followed by **Klaten** at **6.19%**.

items.title: India’s logistic firm Delhivery shares hits 52-week low
items.summary:
- Delhivery's shares fell 5% on Jan. 22, touching a 52-week low of 312.40 rupees (around US$3.61).
- The stock later recovered slightly but closed at 319.45 rupees (around US$3.69), down 2.86%.
- The stock has dropped over 18% in the past year and is 34% below its 52-week high of 488.05 rupees (around US$5.64).
- Increased insourcing by major client Meesho has pressured Delhivery’s growth, affecting its logistics services reliance.

items.title: Consumer spending on AI apps reaches $1.1b in 2024: report
items.summary:
- Consumer spending on AI-powered mobile applications hit $1.1 billion globally in 2024, according to Sensor Tower.
- Users spent over 7.7 billion hours engaging with these applications, with downloads reaching 17 billion.
- Leading factors for this growth included the launch of Google's Gemini app and the availability of OpenAI's ChatGPT.
- Overall, in-app purchases and subscription revenue for mobile apps increased by 13%, totaling $150 billion.

items.title: Indian tribunal suspends data-sharing ban on WhatsApp, Meta
items.summary:
- An Indian appeals tribunal has suspended a five-year data-sharing ban on WhatsApp and Meta.
- The ban restricted user data sharing for advertising between the two companies.
- The competition regulator implemented the ban to prevent potential misuse of user data.
- The tribunal's ruling temporarily halts the enforcement of the ban during the legal review.
- No final decision has been reached, and scrutiny on data privacy issues continues for Meta and WhatsApp.

items.title: LinkedIn sued over alleged InMail data use for AI training
items.summary:
- LinkedIn faces a proposed class action lawsuit from Premium customers for disclosing private messages for AI training.
- The lawsuit, filed on Jan. 23, 2025, claims a privacy policy update in September 2024 allowed user data usage for AI, with opting out not affecting prior data use.
- Plaintiffs argue that the updates conceal privacy violations and reduce LinkedIn's legal responsibility, seeking damages for breach of contract and violations of California’s unfair competition law.

items.title: eFishery staff demand answers amid layoff and closure rumors
items.summary:
- Dozens of eFishery Labor Union members protested at the Bandung office regarding concerns about potential mass layoffs and a company shutdown in February.
- The union claims that the company currently has cash and assets exceeding 1 trillion rupiah (US$61.3 million) and urged management to resume operations.
- Internal investigations into financial fraud allegations have led to the resignation of co-founders and an interim CEO, with claims of revenue being inflated by nearly US$600 million.

items.title: Indian healthcare startup Zeelab raises $2.4m for growth
items.author: Rohit Mukul
items.summary:
- Zeelab Pharmacy, a Delhi-based healthcare startup, raised ₹21.7 crore (US$2.4 million) in its first funding round, led by OTP Ventures.
- The funding will be used to expand the retail network and establish a 60-minute delivery service in metro and non-metro cities in India.
- Founded in 2020, Zeelab sources medications from over 2,500 stores, enhancing access in tier-II cities.
- Zeelab enters a competitive market alongside players like Medkart, PharmEasy, Apollo Pharmacy, and Netmeds.

items.title: OpenAI tells India court data deletion breaches US law
items.summary:
• OpenAI argues that a court ruling requiring data deletion violates US laws.
• The case highlights the ongoing legal complexities surrounding data privacy and protection.
• OpenAI’s stance could set a precedent for future international data compliance issues.

items.title: Alphabet’s investment chief warns US AI lead at risk
items.author: Ruth Porat
items.summary:
- Ruth Porat, Alphabet’s president and chief investment officer, warned about the US's diminishing lead in AI due to China's advancements in basic AI adoption.
- At the World Economic Forum, she noted that while the US excels in advanced AI models and chips, China is rapidly catching up.
- Rising geopolitical tensions are influencing AI advancements priorities in both countries.
- Porat called for international cooperation on AI regulations to prevent fragmented policies that could impact investments.
- Alphabet is actively investing in AI, launching the Gemini 2.0 model through Google DeepMind to maintain competitiveness.

items.title: Mistral AI eyes IPO, expands to APAC market
items.summary:
- Mistral AI, founded by ex-Google DeepMind and Meta researchers, aims for an IPO according to CEO Arthur Mensch.
- The company plans to open an office in Singapore to enter the Asia-Pacific market.
- Founded in early 2023, Mistral launched generative AI products, including Le Chat, similar to ChatGPT.
- In 2023, Mistral raised 600 million euros (US$621 million) from investors like General Catalyst, Andreessen Horowitz, and Lightspeed Venture Partners.
- Mistral emphasizes affordability in running AI models and addresses European firms' data privacy concerns.

items.title: CarDekho wins on the path less traveled
items.summary:
- CarDekho established a niche in Southeast Asia's used car market by acting as a finance aggregator, helping buyers secure loans.
- The company reported over US$40 million in revenue in 2024 despite competitors like Cars24 and Zoomcar exiting the region.
- CarDekho is expanding into insurance by looking to acquire smaller brokers in Indonesia and the Philippines.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s education startups?
items.summary:
- The article discusses investments in education startups in Southeast Asia (SEA).
- Highlights key investors and their contributions to the education sector in the region.
- Explores the trends and growth potential of education technology in SEA.

items.title: Singapore-based TikTok-like app gains traction in US
items.summary:
- Likee, a Singapore-based TikTok-like app, saw a 143% spike in downloads and a 37% rise in user activity on Jan. 18.
- On Jan. 19, usage increased by an additional 11%.
- Daily downloads soared from fewer than 10,000 to nearly 167,000 on Jan. 19 and reached 286,000 on Jan. 20.
- Launched in 2017 by Joyy, Likee has 33.9 million monthly users as of November, primarily outside the US.
- TikTok's uncertain future in the US following a temporary ban is benefiting alternative apps like Likee.

items.title: Electronic Arts shares drop 7% on weak soccer title sales
items.summary:
- Electronic Arts (EA) shares decreased by 7% in after-hours trading on Jan. 22.
- The drop followed a downward revision of the full-year net bookings forecast.
- Key reasons include weaker performance in several games, particularly in EA Sports FC.
- EA reported a decline in sales of its soccer franchise during the December quarter, ending a two-year trend of double-digit growth.
- The franchise was rebranded as EA Sports FC in 2022 after ending the collaboration with FIFA.

items.title: Taiwan tech firm expects business rebound in Q2 2025
items.summary:
- Taiwan's tech firm anticipates a rebound in business during the second quarter of 2025.
- The recovery is expected due to various economic factors and market conditions.
- Company representatives discussed strategies to enhance growth and competitiveness in the upcoming months.

items.title: Enterprise AI startup raises $7m to develop secure platform
items.summary:
- Doti AI raised US$7 million in seed funding, led by F2 Venture Capital with support from angel investors Jared Kasner and Guy Flechter.
- The startup's platform, Work AI, enables secure real-time access and use of internal data for enterprises.
- Work AI consolidates data from multiple sources and can be deployed on-site or in the cloud within one hour.
- It includes enhanced permissions and access controls to mitigate data breach risks and ensure industry compliance.
- The enterprise AI market is expected to grow from US$113.5 billion in 2023 to over US$300 billion by 2030, driven by demand for improved workflows and decision-making tools.

items.title: ByteDance launches AI model Doubao 1.5 Pro
items.summary:
- ByteDance launched Doubao 1.5 Pro on January 22.
- The AI model showcases advancements in AI technology amidst US export restrictions on advanced chips.
- Doubao 1.5 Pro features a resource-efficient training method to improve performance and decrease costs.
- The model utilizes a server cluster compatible with low-end chips, reducing infrastructure expenses.

items.title: Taiwan’s chipmaker UMC forecasts low growth this year
items.summary:
- UMC anticipates modest growth for the year 2025.
- Factors influencing growth predictions include global market conditions and demand trends.
- The company highlights challenges faced in the semiconductor industry.

items.title: VC firm Greylock names new partner for Israeli investments
